```{r setup, include=FALSE}

library(tidyverse)

set.seed(1)
source("source/sim_mean_sd.R")

```

we can "simulate" by running our function

```{r}
sim_mean_sd(n = 400)
```

can i verfiy thw central limit theorem?

 first with a `for` loop 

```{r}
output = vector("list", 100)

for (i in 1:100) {
  output[[i]] = sim_mean_sd(30)
}

sim_results = bind_rows(output)

output |>
  bind_rows() |>
  ggplot(aes(x = mu_hat)) +
  geom_density()


```


try to repeat with a `map` statement 

```{r}
sim_results_df =
  expand_grid( 
    sample_size = c(30, 60, 90,120),
    iter = 1:1000
  ) |> 
  mutate(
    results = map(sample_size, sim_mean_sd)
  ) |>
  unnest(results)
```


look at this

```{r}
sim_results_df |>
  mutate(
    sample_size = str_c("n =", sample_size),
    sample_size = fct_inorder(sample_size)
  ) |>
  
ggplot(aes(x = sample_size, y = mu_hat)) +
geom_violin()
```

lets try to summarize

```{r}
sim_results_df |>
  group_by(sample_size) |>
  summarize(
    emp_mean = mean(mu_hat),
    emp_se = sd(mu_hat)
  )
```


## Simple Linear regression 

```{r}
sim_df = 
  tibble(
    x = rnorm(30, mean = 1, sd = 1),
    y = 2+3 * x + rnorm(30,0,1)
  )

sim_df |>
  ggplot(aes(x = x, y = y)) +
  geom_point()

slr_fit = lm(y ~ x, data =sim_df)

coef(slr_fit)
```


turn this into a function 
```{r}
sim_regression = function( n, beta_0 = 2, beta_1 = 3) {
 
  sim_df = 
  tibble(
    x = rnorm(n, mean = 1, sd = 1),
    y = beta_0 + beta_1 * x + rnorm(n, 0, 1)
  )

slr_fit = lm(y ~ x, data =sim_df)


tibble( 
  beta0_hat = coef(slr_fit)[1],
  beta1_hat = coef(slr_fit)[2]
  )
}

```


```{r}
sim_regression(n = 30)
```


```{r}
output = vector("list", length = 500)

for (i in 1:500) {
  output[[i]] = sim_regression(n = 30)
}

output |>
  bind_rows()
```


```{r}
slr_sim_results_df = 
  expand_grid(
    sample_size = 30,
    iter = 1:500
  )|>
  mutate(
    results = map(sample_size, sim_regression)
  ) |>
  
  unnest(results)

slr_sim_results_df |>
 ggplot(aes(x = beta0_hat, y = beta1_hat)) + 
  geom_point()
```


## One More example!

```{r}
birthdays = sample(1:365, 5, replace = TRUE)

repeated_bday = length(unique(birthdays)) < 5

repeated_bday

```



plot this into a function
```{r}
bday_sim = function (n_room) {
  
  birthdays = sample(1:365, n_room, replace = TRUE)

repeated_bday = length(unique(birthdays)) < n_room

repeated_bday
  
}

bday_sim(20)
```



```{r}
bday_sim_results = 
  expand_grid(
    bdays = 5:50,
    iter = 1:12500
  ) |>
  mutate(
    results = map_lgl(bdays, bday_sim)
  ) |>
  group_by(bdays) |>
  summarize(
    prob_repeat = mean(results)
  )
 
```


plot this 

```{r}
bday_sim_results |>
  ggplot(aes(x = bdays, y = prob_repeat)) +
  geom_point() +
  geom_line()
```
